item.title: Japan Blog 11
item.description: My interest with Osaka started with an action-adventure game called Yakuza 0. The game takes place in 1988 and is set in Tokyo’s Kabukichō and Osaka’s Dōtonbori.

item.title: Japan Blog 10
item.description: I’ve never flown domestically within another country before this trip to Japan. I was unsure of what the process would be like.

item.title: Japan Blog 09
item.description: This is it. Tomorrow morning, I embark on my second trip to Japan. For the next week, I’ll explore Osaka, Kyoto and Nara.

item.title: 日本語が大好きです
item.description: Regarded as one of the most difficult languages to learn, I never thought I’d study Japanese.

item.title: Norway Blog 03
item.description: The ferry from Tørvikbygd to Jondal is a short but pleasant experience. With an average time of twenty minutes to cross, Myles and I were able to use the bathroom, take pictures and even grab food from the onboard deli.

item.title: Norway Blog 02
item.description: Norway has a lot of tunnels. The majority are short, between a half mile to a few miles long.

item.title: Norway Blog 01
item.description: I touched down in Norway to a sunny view of distant fjords, islands and a fleet of helicopters.

item.title: Norway Blog 00
item.description: This is it. The final night before I commence my trip to the beautiful country of Norway.

item.title: Iceland Blog 07
item.description: After a quick breakfast at Reykjavik Lights on Monday morning, Myles and I checked out of the hotel.

item.title: Iceland Blog 06
item.description: Myles and I did not have a lot planned for the final day in Iceland.

item.title: Iceland Blog 05
item.description: First and foremost, I should mention that I travel light. For the past year of travel, even to Japan, I’ve packed one pair of pants to cut down on space in my backpack.

item.title: Iceland Blog 04
item.description: The drive to Skaftafell, a wilderness area inside of Vatnajökull National Park, took over four hours.

item.title: Iceland Blog 03
item.description: There were still plenty of sites to see in Iceland, far too many. Thursday was dedicated to locations that Myles and I wanted to see towards the north east of Reykjavik.

item.title: Iceland Blog 02
item.description: Wednesday was the most well-thought out and detailed day of the trip. It started with breakfast at the hotel at around seven thirty, with the goal to leave the hotel by eight.

item.title: Hiragana Progress
item.description: Another month has passed, which marks my second month of study with Japanese. Throughout the month of July, I made steady progress with the first Japanese From Zero!

item.title: Learning Hiragana
item.description: There was a time where I could speak Russian. I also had the ability to read Cyrillic script, while also being able to write it in cursive.

item.title: Iceland Blog 01
item.description: The Boeing 757 touched down in Iceland around six thirty in the morning on Tuesday, May 15th.

item.title: Iceland Blog 00
item.description: This is it. Tomorrow morning, I embark on a trip to Iceland with my best friend and co-worker, Myles Kedrowski.

item.title: Japan Blog 08
item.description: As much I hated to return the room key, I checked out of the Hotel Gracery on Monday morning around eight.

item.title: Japan Blog 07
item.description: For the final full day in Tokyo, Japan, I wanted to visit Ikebukuro for the Pokémon Center and revisit Akihabara.

item.title: Japan Blog 06
item.description: Saturday in Tokyo was unique. I slept in for once, which provided an opportunity to seek breakfast somewhere other than Burger King.

item.title: Japan Blog 05
item.description: Friday morning, I was out the door by seven. Breakfast was at Burger King, my new usual spot in Shinjuku.

item.title: Japan Blog 04
item.description: I woke around three in the morning. Through the window in the hotel room, I could see that the night life was still active down the block.

item.title: Japan Blog 03
item.description: It was dark when the train pulled out of Narita. I did not expect this.

item.title: Japan Blog 02
item.description: Immigration is a strange place to be alone, especially if you don’t speak the native language.

item.title: Japan Blog 01
item.description: 6265 miles. That’s how far I had to travel to get to Tokyo, Japan. Thankfully, I managed to due so in comfort aboard an American Airlines Boeing 787 Dreamliner.

item.title: Japan Blog 00
item.description: This is it. Tonight is my last full night within the United States, at least for the next week.
